alert.note: Alert for Elkhart; St. Joseph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:41AM EST until February 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Starke, Pulaski, Marshall, Kosciusko and Fulton IN Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Indiana...Ohio... Saint Joseph River Michigan at Three Rivers affecting Elkhart, St. Joseph MI and Branch Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting Berrien, Elkhart and St. Joseph Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, Defiance and De Kalb Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. .Recent snow melt and rain have led to rises on area rivers. For the Tippecanoe River...including Ora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saint Joseph River Ohio...including Montpelier, Newville... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Tiffin River...including Stryker...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saint Joseph River Michigan...including Three Rivers, South Bend...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The river reaches flood stage with the lowest residential areas beginning to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
